definitions: formal sleeveless garment worn over a shirt and under a jacket or suit
examples: He wore a silk waistcoat beneath his tailored dinner jacket
The Victorian gentleman's waistcoat featured an intricate paisley pattern

definitions: period of time during which one delays action or remains inactive
act of staying in expectation of something happening
examples: The wait for test results seemed endless and stressful
After a three-hour wait, the doctor finally called them in
The restaurant wait stretched beyond their lunch break allowance
Their wait for approval lasted several weeks of uncertainty

definitions: person who serves food and drinks to customers in restaurants or cafes
examples: The waiter recommended the chef's special with enthusiasm
An experienced waiter can manage multiple tables simultaneously

definitions: action of staying where one is or delaying action temporarily
state of being ready or available for something to happen
examples: The waiting became unbearable as hours passed without news
Waiting for exam results creates significant stress for students
The ship remained in waiting position outside the harbor
Her waiting status changed when the position finally opened

definitions: legal document that releases someone from a right, claim, or privilege
voluntary act of giving up or not insisting on a particular right
examples: Participants must sign a liability waiver before joining the activity
The insurance waiver saved them hundreds of dollars annually
The university granted a waiver for the foreign language requirement
She requested a fee waiver due to financial hardship

definitions: social gathering held after someone's death, typically involving the body
trail of disturbed water left by something moving through it
period or consequences following an event, especially something dramatic
examples: The Irish wake continued through the night with stories and songs
Family members gathered for the wake before the funeral service
The speedboat left a foamy wake across the calm lake
Dolphins played in the wake of the cruise ship
In the wake of the scandal, several executives resigned
The town struggled to rebuild in the wake of the hurricane

definitions: state of being awake and conscious rather than sleeping
process or moment of becoming awake from sleep
examples: His waking hours were devoted to solving the complex problem
She spent every waking moment thinking about the project
The baby's waking disrupted the entire household at dawn
Her sudden waking from the nightmare left her disoriented

definitions: journey on foot at a moderate pace for exercise or pleasure
path or route designed for pedestrians to walk along
organized event where people walk together for charity or cause
examples: Their evening walk through the park became a daily ritual
The doctor recommended a brisk walk every morning for health
The coastal walk offers spectacular views of the ocean
A tree-lined walk connects the two campus buildings
The charity walk raised thousands for cancer research
Hundreds participated in the annual awareness walk downtown

definitions: informal walk through a crowd by an important person, especially royalty
traditional journey through the wilderness undertaken by Australian Aboriginal peoples
examples: The royal walkabout allowed citizens to meet the visiting dignitaries
Politicians often do walkabouts during election campaigns to meet voters
The young man went on walkabout to connect with ancestral lands
Traditional walkabout serves as a spiritual rite of passage

definitions: person who walks, especially for exercise or as a hobby
frame device used to help people with mobility issues walk safely
examples: Early morning walkers filled the park paths before sunrise
She's an avid walker who covers miles of trails weekly
His grandmother uses a walker to move around the house safely
The hospital provided a walker during his recovery period

definitions: physical activity of moving on foot at a moderate pace
state or quality of being able to move by walking
examples: Walking remains the most accessible form of daily exercise
Regular walking improves cardiovascular health and mental wellbeing
The accident left him with permanent walking difficulties
Her walking speed increased as her recovery progressed

definitions: organized work stoppage where employees leave their workplace in protest
act of leaving a meeting or event as a form of protest
examples: The factory walkout lasted three days before negotiations resumed
Union members voted overwhelmingly to support the planned walkout
Several delegates staged a walkout during the controversial speech
The student walkout protested the administration's new policies

definitions: competition or contest won with very little effort or opposition
victory achieved when opponent withdraws or fails to appear
examples: The championship match turned into a walkover when their opponents couldn't compete
With their star players injured, the game became a complete walkover
She advanced through a walkover when her tennis opponent withdrew
The election became a walkover with no opposing candidates

definitions: raised or designated path for pedestrians to walk on safely
examples: The covered walkway connects all the campus buildings together
A wooden walkway extends across the wetland preserve area

definitions: vertical structure that divides or encloses an area, typically made of brick or stone
fortified barrier built for defense or protection of a city or territory
figurative barrier that prevents progress, understanding, or communication
examples: The brick wall separated their property from the neighbor's yard
They painted the living room walls a warm shade of blue
The ancient city wall still stands after thousands of years
Guards patrolled the fortress wall throughout the night
They hit a wall in negotiations over the contract terms
The language barrier created a wall between the communities

definitions: small or medium-sized marsupial similar to but smaller than a kangaroo
examples: The rock wallaby hopped effortlessly across the steep terrain
Several wallabies grazed peacefully in the Australian bushland

definitions: small flat folding case for holding money, cards, and identification documents
examples: He pulled his leather wallet from his back pocket
Her wallet contained credit cards, cash, and family photos

definitions: fragrant flowering plant that grows on walls and rocky places
person who remains on the sidelines at social events due to shyness
examples: Orange wallflowers bloomed brilliantly against the old stone wall
The garden's wallflowers released their sweet evening fragrance
She played the wallflower at parties, watching others dance
Don't be a wallflower; join the conversation and meet people

definitions: heavy blow or punch delivered with great force
powerful effect or impact of something
examples: The boxer delivered a tremendous wallop to his opponent's jaw
The ball took a wallop from the bat and sailed over the fence
The storm packed quite a wallop when it hit the coast
The new tax policy will deliver a financial wallop to businesses

definitions: decorative paper or material applied to interior walls of rooms
background image displayed on a computer or phone screen
examples: They chose floral wallpaper for the dining room renovation
Removing old wallpaper revealed layers of previous decorating choices
She changed her desktop wallpaper to a scenic mountain photograph
The phone's wallpaper featured a picture of her family

definitions: edible nut with a wrinkled shell from the walnut tree
large deciduous tree that produces walnuts and valuable timber
dark hardwood from walnut trees used in furniture making
examples: She added chopped walnuts to the brownie batter for texture
Walnuts provide healthy omega-3 fatty acids and protein
The ancient walnut tree shaded the entire backyard beautifully
Black walnut trees can live for over 200 years
The antique desk was crafted from solid walnut wood
Walnut remains a popular choice for high-end furniture

definitions: ballroom dance in triple time performed by couples rotating and progressing
piece of music written in three-four time for waltzing
examples: They performed a graceful waltz at their wedding reception
Learning the Viennese waltz requires practice and coordination
Strauss composed many famous waltzes during the nineteenth century
The orchestra played a beautiful waltz for the final dance

definitions: thin stick supposedly used by magicians and fairies to perform magic
slender handheld device used for specific purposes like scanning
examples: The wizard waved his wand and sparks flew from its tip
The fairy godmother's wand transformed the pumpkin into a carriage
The security guard passed the metal detector wand over visitors
She used a curling wand to style her hair perfectly

definitions: person who travels from place to place without a fixed home
someone who moves about without clear purpose or direction
examples: The ancient wanderer shared tales from distant lands
Desert wanderers developed unique survival skills over generations
He became a wanderer after losing his sense of purpose
The wanderer drifted through life without clear goals

definitions: act of moving about without a fixed course or destination
state of thoughts or attention moving away from focus
examples: Years of wandering taught him about different cultures worldwide
Their wandering through Europe lasted several adventurous months
His mind's wandering during meetings concerned his supervisor
The patient's wandering thoughts indicated possible cognitive decline

definitions: strong desire or impulse to travel and explore the world
examples: Her wanderlust led her to visit fifty countries before thirty
The travel blog appeals to readers with serious wanderlust

definitions: period when something gradually decreases in size, intensity, or importance
phase of the moon when it appears to decrease in size
examples: Public interest was on the wane after the initial excitement
The empire's power began its wane in the fifth century
During the moon's wane, the nights grew progressively darker
The wane of the harvest moon signaled winter's approach

definitions: process of gradually decreasing in size, amount, intensity, or importance
phase when the moon appears to grow smaller after the full moon
examples: The waning of traditional industries affected the entire region
His waning enthusiasm for the project worried team members
The waning moon cast less light over the landscape
During the waning phase, lunar observations become more challenging

definitions: person who tries to be like someone else or to fit into a particular group
examples: The music industry attracts many wannabe rock stars annually
Fashion wannabes copied every detail of the celebrity's style

definitions: feeling of desire or need for something considered necessary
state of lacking something essential or being in poverty
examples: Her want for recognition drove her ambitious career choices
The child's want of affection affected his emotional development
Many families live in want despite working multiple jobs
The charity helps those in want during the winter months

definitions: state of armed conflict between nations, states, or groups
sustained campaign or struggle against something undesirable
examples: The war lasted six years and affected millions of civilians
Nations sought diplomatic solutions to prevent another war
The war on poverty requires comprehensive social programs
They declared war on the invasive species threatening local ecosystems

definitions: small singing bird with a melodious song, typically found in woodlands
examples: The yellow warbler's cheerful song filled the spring morning
Birdwatchers identified several warbler species during the migration

definitions: separate room or division in a hospital for particular patients
person, especially a child, under legal protection of a guardian
administrative division of a city or town for electoral purposes
examples: The pediatric ward treated children with various medical conditions
Nurses in the emergency ward worked through the busy night
The court appointed her as ward of her deceased sister's children
The young ward inherited a substantial estate upon maturity
Each ward elects its own representative to the city council
The third ward includes the historic downtown district

definitions: person in charge of a prison or correctional facility
official responsible for supervising a particular area or activity
examples: The prison warden implemented new rehabilitation programs for inmates
She served as warden of the state penitentiary for decades
The game warden patrolled the forest for illegal hunting activity
Traffic wardens issued parking tickets throughout the downtown area

definitions: officer who guards prisoners in a jail or prison facility
examples: The warder conducted hourly checks on all prison cells
Experienced warders know how to defuse tense situations peacefully

definitions: large cupboard or closet for storing clothes and accessories
person's entire collection of clothes they own
department responsible for costumes in theater or film production
examples: The antique wardrobe stood majestically in the master bedroom
They assembled the new wardrobe according to the instructions
She updated her professional wardrobe for the new job
His minimalist wardrobe consisted of neutral, versatile pieces
The wardrobe department created period-accurate costumes for the film
She worked in wardrobe for several Broadway productions

definitions: articles of a particular type, especially pottery or items for sale
examples: The shop displayed beautiful ceramic ware from local artisans
Kitchen ware filled the shelves of the home goods store

definitions: large building for storing goods, materials, or merchandise in bulk
examples: The distribution warehouse employed hundreds of workers year-round
Forklifts moved pallets throughout the massive warehouse space

definitions: commercial operation of storing goods in warehouses for distribution
examples: Modern warehousing uses automated systems for inventory management
The company specializes in cold storage warehousing for food products

definitions: engagement in or activities involved in war or conflict
particular way or method of fighting or competing
examples: Modern warfare involves sophisticated technology and cyber capabilities
The history course examined warfare throughout different civilizations
Psychological warfare aimed to demoralize the enemy without physical combat
Corporate warfare between the companies intensified with aggressive tactics

definitions: explosive or toxic material section of a missile, torpedo, or similar weapon
examples: The missile's warhead contained conventional explosives, not nuclear material
Technicians carefully disarmed the old warhead for safe disposal

definitions: man who practices witchcraft or magic, especially in fantasy contexts
examples: The ancient warlock cast powerful spells from his tower
In the game, players can choose to be a warlock character

definitions: military commander who controls a region through armed forces rather than legal authority
examples: Regional warlords competed for control after the government collapsed
The warlord maintained power through intimidation and private armies

definitions: device designed to provide heat or maintain warmth
piece of clothing worn to provide extra warmth to body parts
examples: The bottle warmer heated the baby's milk to the perfect temperature
She placed the coffee on the mug warmer while working
Leg warmers became a fashion trend in the nineteen-eighties
The pitcher wore arm warmers between innings

definitions: process of becoming or making something warmer in temperature
preliminary exercises done before sports or physical activity
examples: Global warming poses significant threats to coastal communities worldwide
The warming of ocean waters affects marine ecosystems dramatically
Proper warming before exercise prevents injuries and improves performance
The team's warming routine lasted twenty minutes

definitions: quality or state of being warm in temperature
quality of being friendly, kind, and showing genuine care
examples: The fire's warmth spread throughout the cold cabin
Cats seek warmth by lying in sunny spots
Her warmth and compassion made everyone feel welcome
The teacher's warmth encouraged students to ask questions

definitions: person who gives notice of danger or provides cautionary advice
examples: The weather warner alerted residents about the approaching storm
She acted as a warner about the company's risky investments

definitions: statement or event that alerts someone to possible danger or problem
advance notice of something that will or may happen
examples: The weather service issued a severe storm warning for the region
Warning labels on cigarette packages describe health risks
His poor grades served as a warning about his study habits
The supervisor gave her a final warning about tardiness

definitions: bend or distortion in shape caused by heat, moisture, or pressure
lengthwise threads on a loom over which other threads are woven
examples: The wooden floor developed a warp from water damage
Heat caused a noticeable warp in the plastic dashboard
She threaded the warp carefully before beginning to weave
The warp threads must be kept under proper tension

definitions: state of being very angry and ready to fight or punish someone
examples: The manager was on the warpath after discovering the accounting errors
When mom's on the warpath, it's best to stay out of her way
